scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Noble patricians, patrons of my right,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Defend the justice of my cause with arms,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And, countrymen, my loving followers,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Plead my successive title with your swords:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: I am his first-born son, that was the last

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: That wore the imperial diadem of Rome;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Then let my father's honours live in me,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Nor wrong mine age with this indignity.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Romans, friends, followers, favorers of my right,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: If ever Bassianus, Caesar's son,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Were gracious in the eyes of royal Rome,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Keep then this passage to the Capitol

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: And suffer not dishonour to approach

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: The imperial seat, to virtue consecrate,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: To justice, continence and nobility;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: But let desert in pure election shine,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: And, Romans, fight for freedom in your choice.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Princes, that strive by factions and by friends

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Ambitiously for rule and empery,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Know that the people of Rome, for whom we stand

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: A special party, have, by common voice,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: In election for the Roman empery,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Chosen Andronicus, surnamed Pius

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: For many good and great deserts to Rome:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: A nobler man, a braver warrior,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lives not this day within the city walls:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: He by the senate is accit'd home

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: From weary wars against the barbarous Goths;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: That, with his sons, a terror to our foes,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Hath yoked a nation strong, train'd up in arms.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Ten years are spent since first he undertook

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: This cause of Rome and chastised with arms

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Our enemies' pride: five times he hath return'd

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Bleeding to Rome, bearing his valiant sons

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: In coffins from the field;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And now at last, laden with horror's spoils,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Returns the good Andronicus to Rome,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Renowned Titus, flourishing in arms.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Let us entreat, by honour of his name,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Whom worthily you would have now succeed.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And in the Capitol and senate's right,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Whom you pretend to honour and adore,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: That you withdraw you and abate your strength;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Dismiss your followers and, as suitors should,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Plead your deserts in peace and humbleness.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: How fair the tribune speaks to calm my thoughts!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Marcus Andronicus, so I do ally

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: In thy uprightness and integrity,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: And so I love and honour thee and thine,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Thy noble brother Titus and his sons,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: And her to whom my thoughts are humbled all,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Gracious Lavinia, Rome's rich ornament,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: That I will here dismiss my loving friends,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: And to my fortunes and the people's favor

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Commit my cause in balance to be weigh'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Friends, that have been thus forward in my right,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: I thank you all and here dismiss you all,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And to the love and favor of my country

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Commit myself, my person and the cause.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Rome, be as just and gracious unto me

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: As I am confident and kind to thee.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Open the gates, and let me in.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Tribunes, and me, a poor competitor.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: Captain
line: Romans, make way: the good Andronicus.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: Captain
line: Patron of virtue, Rome's best champion,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: Captain
line: Successful in the battles that he fights,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: Captain
line: With honour and with fortune is return'd

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: Captain
line: From where he circumscribed with his sword,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: Captain
line: And brought to yoke, the enemies of Rome.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Hail, Rome, victorious in thy mourning weeds!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lo, as the bark, that hath discharged her fraught,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Returns with precious jading to the bay

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: From whence at first she weigh'd her anchorage,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Cometh Andronicus, bound with laurel boughs,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To re-salute his country with his tears,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Tears of true joy for his return to Rome.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thou great defender of this Capitol,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Stand gracious to the rites that we intend!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Romans, of five and twenty valiant sons,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Half of the number that King Priam had,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Behold the poor remains, alive and dead!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: These that survive let Rome reward with love;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: These that I bring unto their latest home,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: With burial amongst their ancestors:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Here Goths have given me leave to sheathe my sword.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Titus, unkind and careless of thine own,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Why suffer'st thou thy sons, unburied yet,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To hover on the dreadful shore of Styx?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Make way to lay them by their brethren.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: There greet in silence, as the dead are wont,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And sleep in peace, slain in your country's wars!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: O sacred receptacle of my joys,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Sweet cell of virtue and nobility,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: How many sons of mine hast thou in store,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: That thou wilt never render to me more!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Give us the proudest prisoner of the Goths,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: That we may hew his limbs, and on a pile

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Ad manes fratrum sacrifice his flesh,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Before this earthy prison of their bones;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: That so the shadows be not unappeased,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Nor we disturb'd with prodigies on earth.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I give him you, the noblest that survives,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: The eldest son of this distressed queen.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Stay, Roman brethren! Gracious conqueror,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Victorious Titus, rue the tears I shed,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: A mother's tears in passion for her son:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And if thy sons were ever dear to thee,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: O, think my son to be as dear to me!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Sufficeth not that we are brought to Rome,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: To beautify thy triumphs and return,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Captive to thee and to thy Roman yoke,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: But must my sons be slaughter'd in the streets,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: For valiant doings in their country's cause?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: O, if to fight for king and commonweal

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Were piety in thine, it is in these.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Andronicus, stain not thy tomb with blood:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Wilt thou draw near the nature of the gods?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Draw near them then in being merciful:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Sweet mercy is nobility's true badge:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Thrice noble Titus, spare my first-born son.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Patient yourself, madam, and pardon me.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: These are their brethren, whom you Goths beheld

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Alive and dead, and for their brethren slain

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Religiously they ask a sacrifice:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To this your son is mark'd, and die he must,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To appease their groaning shadows that are gone.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Away with him! and make a fire straight;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: And with our swords, upon a pile of wood,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Let's hew his limbs till they be clean consumed.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: O cruel, irreligious piety!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Was ever Scythia half so barbarous?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Oppose not Scythia to ambitious Rome.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Alarbus goes to rest; and we survive

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: To tremble under Titus' threatening looks.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Then, madam, stand resolved, but hope withal

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: The self-same gods that arm'd the Queen of Troy

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: With opportunity of sharp revenge

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Upon the Thracian tyrant in his tent,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: May favor Tamora, the Queen of Goths--

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: When Goths were Goths and Tamora was queen--

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: To quit the bloody wrongs upon her foes.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: See, lord and father, how we have perform'd

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Our Roman rites: Alarbus' limbs are lopp'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: And entrails feed the sacrificing fire,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Whose smoke, like incense, doth perfume the sky.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Remaineth nought, but to inter our brethren,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: And with loud 'larums welcome them to Rome.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Let it be so; and let Andronicus

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Make this his latest farewell to their souls.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: In peace and honour rest you here, my sons;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Rome's readiest champions, repose you here in rest,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Secure from worldly chances and mishaps!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Here lurks no treason, here no envy swells,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Here grow no damned grudges; here are no storms,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: No noise, but silence and eternal sleep:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: In peace and honour rest you here, my sons!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: In peace and honour live Lord Titus long;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: My noble lord and father, live in fame!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Lo, at this tomb my tributary tears

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: I render, for my brethren's obsequies;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: And at thy feet I kneel, with tears of joy,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Shed on the earth, for thy return to Rome:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: O, bless me here with thy victorious hand,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Whose fortunes Rome's best citizens applaud!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Kind Rome, that hast thus lovingly reserved

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: The cordial of mine age to glad my heart!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lavinia, live; outlive thy father's days,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And fame's eternal date, for virtue's praise!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Long live Lord Titus, my beloved brother,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Gracious triumpher in the eyes of Rome!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thanks, gentle tribune, noble brother Marcus.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And welcome, nephews, from successful wars,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: You that survive, and you that sleep in fame!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Fair lords, your fortunes are alike in all,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: That in your country's service drew your swords:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: But safer triumph is this funeral pomp,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: That hath aspired to Solon's happiness

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And triumphs over chance in honour's bed.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Titus Andronicus, the people of Rome,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Whose friend in justice thou hast ever been,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Send thee by me, their tribune and their trust,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: This palliament of white and spotless hue;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And name thee in election for the empire,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: With these our late-deceased emperor's sons:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Be candidatus then, and put it on,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And help to set a head on headless Rome.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: A better head her glorious body fits

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Than his that shakes for age and feebleness:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: What should I don this robe, and trouble you?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Be chosen with proclamations to-day,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To-morrow yield up rule, resign my life,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And set abroad new business for you all?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Rome, I have been thy soldier forty years,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And led my country's strength successfully,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And buried one and twenty valiant sons,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Knighted in field, slain manfully in arms,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: In right and service of their noble country

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Give me a staff of honour for mine age,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But not a sceptre to control the world:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Upright he held it, lords, that held it last.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Titus, thou shalt obtain and ask the empery.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Proud and ambitious tribune, canst thou tell?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Patience, Prince Saturninus.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Romans, do me right:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Patricians, draw your swords: and sheathe them not

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Till Saturninus be Rome's emperor.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Andronicus, would thou wert shipp'd to hell,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Rather than rob me of the people's hearts!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Proud Saturnine, interrupter of the good

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: That noble-minded Titus means to thee!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Content thee, prince; I will restore to thee

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: The people's hearts, and wean them from themselves.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Andronicus, I do not flatter thee,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: But honour thee, and will do till I die:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: My faction if thou strengthen with thy friends,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: I will most thankful be; and thanks to men

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Of noble minds is honourable meed.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: People of Rome, and people's tribunes here,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I ask your voices and your suffrages:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Will you bestow them friendly on Andronicus?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: Tribunes
line: To gratify the good Andronicus,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: Tribunes
line: And gratulate his safe return to Rome,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: Tribunes
line: The people will accept whom he admits.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Tribunes, I thank you: and this suit I make,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: That you create your emperor's eldest son,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lord Saturnine; whose virtues will, I hope,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Reflect on Rome as Titan's rays on earth,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And ripen justice in this commonweal:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Then, if you will elect by my advice,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Crown him and say 'Long live our emperor!'

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: With voices and applause of every sort,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Patricians and plebeians, we create

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lord Saturninus Rome's great emperor,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And say 'Long live our Emperor Saturnine!'

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Titus Andronicus, for thy favors done

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: To us in our election this day,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: I give thee thanks in part of thy deserts,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And will with deeds requite thy gentleness:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And, for an onset, Titus, to advance

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Thy name and honourable family,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Lavinia will I make my empress,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Rome's royal mistress, mistress of my heart,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And in the sacred Pantheon her espouse:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Tell me, Andronicus, doth this motion please thee?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: It doth, my worthy lord; and in this match

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I hold me highly honour'd of your grace:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And here in sight of Rome to Saturnine,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: King and commander of our commonweal,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: The wide world's emperor, do I consecrate

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: My sword, my chariot and my prisoners;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Presents well worthy Rome's imperial lord:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Receive them then, the tribute that I owe,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Mine honour's ensigns humbled at thy feet.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Thanks, noble Titus, father of my life!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: How proud I am of thee and of thy gifts

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Rome shall record, and when I do forget

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: The least of these unspeakable deserts,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Romans, forget your fealty to me.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To TAMORA  Now, madam, are you prisoner to

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: an emperor;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To him that, for your honour and your state,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Will use you nobly and your followers.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: A goodly lady, trust me; of the hue

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: That I would choose, were I to choose anew.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Clear up, fair queen, that cloudy countenance:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Though chance of war hath wrought this change of cheer,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Thou comest not to be made a scorn in Rome:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Princely shall be thy usage every way.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Rest on my word, and let not discontent

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Daunt all your hopes: madam, he comforts you

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Can make you greater than the Queen of Goths.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Lavinia, you are not displeased with this?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Not I, my lord; sith true nobility

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Warrants these words in princely courtesy.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Thanks, sweet Lavinia. Romans, let us go;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Ransomless here we set our prisoners free:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Proclaim our honours, lords, with trump and drum.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Lord Titus, by your leave, this maid is mine.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: How, sir! are you in earnest then, my lord?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Ay, noble Titus; and resolved withal

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: To do myself this reason and this right.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: 'Suum cuique' is our Roman justice:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: This prince in justice seizeth but his own.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: And that he will, and shall, if Lucius live.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Traitors, avaunt! Where is the emperor's guard?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Treason, my lord! Lavinia is surprised!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Surprised! by whom?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: By him that justly may

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Bear his betroth'd from all the world away.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MUTIUS
line: Brothers, help to convey her hence away,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MUTIUS
line: And with my sword I'll keep this door safe.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Follow, my lord, and I'll soon bring her back.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MUTIUS
line: My lord, you pass not here.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: What, villain boy!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Barr'st me my way in Rome?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MUTIUS
line: Help, Lucius, help!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: My lord, you are unjust, and, more than so,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: In wrongful quarrel you have slain your son.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Nor thou, nor he, are any sons of mine;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: My sons would never so dishonour me:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Traitor, restore Lavinia to the emperor.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Dead, if you will; but not to be his wife,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: That is another's lawful promised love.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: No, Titus, no; the emperor needs her not,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Nor her, nor thee, nor any of thy stock:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: I'll trust, by leisure, him that mocks me once;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Thee never, nor thy traitorous haughty sons,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Confederates all thus to dishonour me.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Was there none else in Rome to make a stale,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: But Saturnine? Full well, Andronicus,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Agree these deeds with that proud brag of thine,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: That said'st I begg'd the empire at thy hands.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: O monstrous! what reproachful words are these?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: But go thy ways; go, give that changing piece

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: To him that flourish'd for her with his sword

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: A valiant son-in-law thou shalt enjoy;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: One fit to bandy with thy lawless sons,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: To ruffle in the commonwealth of Rome.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: These words are razors to my wounded heart.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And therefore, lovely Tamora, queen of Goths,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: That like the stately Phoebe 'mongst her nymphs

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Dost overshine the gallant'st dames of Rome,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: If thou be pleased with this my sudden choice,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Behold, I choose thee, Tamora, for my bride,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And will create thee empress of Rome,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Speak, Queen of Goths, dost thou applaud my choice?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And here I swear by all the Roman gods,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Sith priest and holy water are so near

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And tapers burn so bright and every thing

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: In readiness for Hymenaeus stand,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: I will not re-salute the streets of Rome,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Or climb my palace, till from forth this place

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: I lead espoused my bride along with me.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And here, in sight of heaven, to Rome I swear,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: If Saturnine advance the Queen of Goths,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: She will a handmaid be to his desires,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: A loving nurse, a mother to his youth.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Ascend, fair queen, Pantheon. Lords, accompany

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Your noble emperor and his lovely bride,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Sent by the heavens for Prince Saturnine,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Whose wisdom hath her fortune conquered:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: There shall we consummate our spousal rites.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I am not bid to wait upon this bride.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Titus, when wert thou wont to walk alone,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Dishonour'd thus, and challenged of wrongs?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: O Titus, see, O, see what thou hast done!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: In a bad quarrel slain a virtuous son.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: No, foolish tribune, no; no son of mine,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Nor thou, nor these, confederates in the deed

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: That hath dishonour'd all our family;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Unworthy brother, and unworthy sons!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: But let us give him burial, as becomes;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Give Mutius burial with our brethren.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Traitors, away! he rests not in this tomb:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: This monument five hundred years hath stood,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Which I have sumptuously re-edified:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Here none but soldiers and Rome's servitors

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Repose in fame; none basely slain in brawls:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Bury him where you can; he comes not here.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: My lord, this is impiety in you:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: My nephew Mutius' deeds do plead for him

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: He must be buried with his brethren.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: QUINTUS
line: And shall, or him we will accompany.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: 'And shall!' what villain was it that spake

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: that word?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: QUINTUS
line: He that would vouch it in any place but here.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: What, would you bury him in my despite?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: No, noble Titus, but entreat of thee

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: To pardon Mutius and to bury him.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Marcus, even thou hast struck upon my crest,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And, with these boys, mine honour thou hast wounded:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: My foes I do repute you every one;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: So, trouble me no more, but get you gone.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARTIUS
line: He is not with himself; let us withdraw.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: QUINTUS
line: Not I, till Mutius' bones be buried.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Brother, for in that name doth nature plead,--

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: QUINTUS
line: Father, and in that name doth nature speak,--

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Speak thou no more, if all the rest will speed.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Renowned Titus, more than half my soul,--

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Dear father, soul and substance of us all,--

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Suffer thy brother Marcus to inter

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: His noble nephew here in virtue's nest,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: That died in honour and Lavinia's cause.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thou art a Roman; be not barbarous:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: The Greeks upon advice did bury Ajax

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: That slew himself; and wise Laertes' son

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Did graciously plead for his funerals:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Let not young Mutius, then, that was thy joy

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Be barr'd his entrance here.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Rise, Marcus, rise.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: The dismall'st day is this that e'er I saw,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To be dishonour'd by my sons in Rome!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Well, bury him, and bury me the next.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: There lie thy bones, sweet Mutius, with thy friends,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Till we with trophies do adorn thy tomb.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: All
line: Kneeling  No man shed tears for noble Mutius;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: All
line: He lives in fame that died in virtue's cause.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: My lord, to step out of these dreary dumps,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: How comes it that the subtle Queen of Goths

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Is of a sudden thus advanced in Rome?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I know not, Marcus; but I know it is,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Whether by device or no, the heavens can tell:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Is she not then beholding to the man

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: That brought her for this high good turn so far?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Yes, and will nobly him remunerate.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: So, Bassianus, you have play'd your prize:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: God give you joy, sir, of your gallant bride!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: And you of yours, my lord! I say no more,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Nor wish no less; and so, I take my leave.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Traitor, if Rome have law or we have power,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Thou and thy faction shall repent this rape.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Rape, call you it, my lord, to seize my own,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: My truth-betrothed love and now my wife?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: But let the laws of Rome determine all;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Meanwhile I am possess'd of that is mine.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: 'Tis good, sir: you are very short with us;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: But, if we live, we'll be as sharp with you.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: My lord, what I have done, as best I may,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Answer I must and shall do with my life.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Only thus much I give your grace to know:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: By all the duties that I owe to Rome,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: This noble gentleman, Lord Titus here,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Is in opinion and in honour wrong'd;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: That in the rescue of Lavinia

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: With his own hand did slay his youngest son,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: In zeal to you and highly moved to wrath

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: To be controll'd in that he frankly gave:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Receive him, then, to favor, Saturnine,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: That hath express'd himself in all his deeds

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: A father and a friend to thee and Rome.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Prince Bassianus, leave to plead my deeds:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: 'Tis thou and those that have dishonour'd me.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Rome and the righteous heavens be my judge,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: How I have loved and honour'd Saturnine!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: My worthy lord, if ever Tamora

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Were gracious in those princely eyes of thine,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Then hear me speak in indifferently for all;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And at my suit, sweet, pardon what is past.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: What, madam! be dishonour'd openly,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And basely put it up without revenge?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Not so, my lord; the gods of Rome forfend

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: I should be author to dishonour you!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: But on mine honour dare I undertake

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: For good Lord Titus' innocence in all;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Whose fury not dissembled speaks his griefs:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Then, at my suit, look graciously on him;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Lose not so noble a friend on vain suppose,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Nor with sour looks afflict his gentle heart.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Aside to SATURNINUS  My lord, be ruled by me,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: be won at last;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Dissemble all your griefs and discontents:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: You are but newly planted in your throne;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Lest, then, the people, and patricians too,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Upon a just survey, take Titus' part,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And so supplant you for ingratitude,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Which Rome reputes to be a heinous sin,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Yield at entreats; and then let me alone:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: I'll find a day to massacre them all

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And raze their faction and their family,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: The cruel father and his traitorous sons,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: To whom I sued for my dear son's life,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And make them know what 'tis to let a queen

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Kneel in the streets and beg for grace in vain.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Come, come, sweet emperor; come, Andronicus;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Take up this good old man, and cheer the heart

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: That dies in tempest of thy angry frown.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Rise, Titus, rise; my empress hath prevail'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I thank your majesty, and her, my lord:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: These words, these looks, infuse new life in me.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Titus, I am incorporate in Rome,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: A Roman now adopted happily,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And must advise the emperor for his good.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: This day all quarrels die, Andronicus;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And let it be mine honour, good my lord,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: That I have reconciled your friends and you.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: For you, Prince Bassianus, I have pass'd

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: My word and promise to the emperor,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: That you will be more mild and tractable.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And fear not lords, and you, Lavinia;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: By my advice, all humbled on your knees,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: You shall ask pardon of his majesty.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: We do, and vow to heaven and to his highness,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: That what we did was mildly as we might,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Tendering our sister's honour and our own.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: That, on mine honour, here I do protest.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Away, and talk not; trouble us no more.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Nay, nay, sweet emperor, we must all be friends:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: The tribune and his nephews kneel for grace;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TAMORA
line: I will not be denied: sweet heart, look back.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Marcus, for thy sake and thy brother's here,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And at my lovely Tamora's entreats,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: I do remit these young men's heinous faults: Stand up.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Lavinia, though you left me like a churl,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: I found a friend, and sure as death I swore

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: I would not part a bachelor from the priest.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Come, if the emperor's court can feast two brides,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: You are my guest, Lavinia, and your friends.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: This day shall be a love-day, Tamora.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To-morrow, an it please your majesty

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To hunt the panther and the hart with me,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: With horn and hound we'll give your grace bonjour.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Capitol.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Be it so, Titus, and gramercy too.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Now climbeth Tamora Olympus' top,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Safe out of fortune's shot; and sits aloft,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Secure of thunder's crack or lightning flash;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Advanced above pale envy's threatening reach.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: As when the golden sun salutes the morn,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And, having gilt the ocean with his beams,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Gallops the zodiac in his glistering coach,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And overlooks the highest-peering hills;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: So Tamora:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Upon her wit doth earthly honour wait,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And virtue stoops and trembles at her frown.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Then, Aaron, arm thy heart, and fit thy thoughts,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: To mount aloft with thy imperial mistress,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And mount her pitch, whom thou in triumph long

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Hast prisoner held, fetter'd in amorous chains

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And faster bound to Aaron's charming eyes

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Than is Prometheus tied to Caucasus.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Away with slavish weeds and servile thoughts!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: I will be bright, and shine in pearl and gold,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: To wait upon this new-made empress.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: To wait, said I? to wanton with this queen,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: This goddess, this Semiramis, this nymph,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: This siren, that will charm Rome's Saturnine,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And see his shipwreck and his commonweal's.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Holloa! what storm is this?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Chiron, thy years want wit, thy wit wants edge,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: And manners, to intrude where I am graced;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: And may, for aught thou know'st, affected be.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Demetrius, thou dost over-ween in all;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: And so in this, to bear me down with braves.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: 'Tis not the difference of a year or two

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Makes me less gracious or thee more fortunate:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: I am as able and as fit as thou

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: To serve, and to deserve my mistress' grace;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: And that my sword upon thee shall approve,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: And plead my passions for Lavinia's love.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Aside  Clubs, clubs! these lovers will not keep

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: the peace.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Why, boy, although our mother, unadvised,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Gave you a dancing-rapier by your side,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Are you so desperate grown, to threat your friends?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Go to; have your lath glued within your sheath

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Till you know better how to handle it.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Meanwhile, sir, with the little skill I have,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Full well shalt thou perceive how much I dare.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Ay, boy, grow ye so brave?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Coming forward  Why, how now, lords!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: So near the emperor's palace dare you draw,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And maintain such a quarrel openly?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Full well I wot the ground of all this grudge:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: I would not for a million of gold

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: The cause were known to them it most concerns;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Nor would your noble mother for much more

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Be so dishonour'd in the court of Rome.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: For shame, put up.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Not I, till I have sheathed

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: My rapier in his bosom and withal

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Thrust these reproachful speeches down his throat

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: That he hath breathed in my dishonour here.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: For that I am prepared and full resolved.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Foul-spoken coward, that thunder'st with thy tongue,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: And with thy weapon nothing darest perform!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Away, I say!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Now, by the gods that warlike Goths adore,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: This petty brabble will undo us all.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Why, lords, and think you not how dangerous

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: It is to jet upon a prince's right?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: What, is Lavinia then become so loose,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Or Bassianus so degenerate,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: That for her love such quarrels may be broach'd

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Without controlment, justice, or revenge?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Young lords, beware! and should the empress know

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: This discord's ground, the music would not please.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: I care not, I, knew she and all the world:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: I love Lavinia more than all the world.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Youngling, learn thou to make some meaner choice:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Lavinia is thine elder brother's hope.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Why, are ye mad? or know ye not, in Rome

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: How furious and impatient they be,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And cannot brook competitors in love?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: I tell you, lords, you do but plot your deaths

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: By this device.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Aaron, a thousand deaths

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Would I propose to achieve her whom I love.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: To achieve her! how?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Why makest thou it so strange?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: She is a woman, therefore may be woo'd;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: She is a woman, therefore may be won;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: She is Lavinia, therefore must be loved.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: What, man! more water glideth by the mill

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Than wots the miller of; and easy it is

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Of a cut loaf to steal a shive, we know:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Though Bassianus be the emperor's brother.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Better than he have worn Vulcan's badge.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Aside  Ay, and as good as Saturninus may.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Then why should he despair that knows to court it

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: With words, fair looks and liberality?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: What, hast not thou full often struck a doe,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: And borne her cleanly by the keeper's nose?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Why, then, it seems, some certain snatch or so

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Would serve your turns.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Ay, so the turn were served.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Aaron, thou hast hit it.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Would you had hit it too!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Then should not we be tired with this ado.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Why, hark ye, hark ye! and are you such fools

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: To square for this? would it offend you, then

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: That both should speed?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Faith, not me.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Nor me, so I were one.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: For shame, be friends, and join for that you jar:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: 'Tis policy and stratagem must do

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: That you affect; and so must you resolve,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: That what you cannot as you would achieve,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: You must perforce accomplish as you may.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Take this of me: Lucrece was not more chaste

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Than this Lavinia, Bassianus' love.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: A speedier course than lingering languishment

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Must we pursue, and I have found the path.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: My lords, a solemn hunting is in hand;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: There will the lovely Roman ladies troop:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: The forest walks are wide and spacious;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And many unfrequented plots there are

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Fitted by kind for rape and villany:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Single you thither then this dainty doe,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And strike her home by force, if not by words:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: This way, or not at all, stand you in hope.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Come, come, our empress, with her sacred wit

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: To villany and vengeance consecrate,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Will we acquaint with all that we intend;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And she shall file our engines with advice,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: That will not suffer you to square yourselves,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: But to your wishes' height advance you both.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: The emperor's court is like the house of Fame,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: The palace full of tongues, of eyes, and ears:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: The woods are ruthless, dreadful, deaf, and dull;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: There speak, and strike, brave boys, and take

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: your turns;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: There serve your lusts, shadow'd from heaven's eye,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And revel in Lavinia's treasury.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Thy counsel, lad, smells of no cowardice,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Sit fas aut nefas, till I find the stream

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: To cool this heat, a charm to calm these fits.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Before the Palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Per Styga, per manes vehor.

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: The hunt is up, the morn is bright and grey,

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: The fields are fragrant and the woods are green:

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Uncouple here and let us make a bay

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And wake the emperor and his lovely bride

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And rouse the prince and ring a hunter's peal,

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: That all the court may echo with the noise.

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Sons, let it be your charge, as it is ours,

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To attend the emperor's person carefully:

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I have been troubled in my sleep this night,

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But dawning day new comfort hath inspired.

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Many good morrows to your majesty;

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Madam, to you as many and as good:

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I promised your grace a hunter's peal.

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And you have rung it lustily, my lord;

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Somewhat too early for new-married ladies.

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Lavinia, how say you?

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: I say, no;

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: I have been broad awake two hours and more.

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Come on, then; horse and chariots let us have,

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And to our sport.

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Madam, now shall ye see

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Our Roman hunting.

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: I have dogs, my lord,

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Will rouse the proudest panther in the chase,

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And climb the highest promontory top.

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And I have horse will follow where the game

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Makes way, and run like swallows o'er the plain.

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Chiron, we hunt not, we, with horse nor hound,

scene: SCENE II.  A forest near Rome. Horns and cry of hounds heard.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: But hope to pluck a dainty doe to ground.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: He that had wit would think that I had none,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: To bury so much gold under a tree,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: And never after to inherit it.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Let him that thinks of me so abjectly

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Know that this gold must coin a stratagem,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Which, cunningly effected, will beget

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: A very excellent piece of villany:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: And so repose, sweet gold, for their unrest

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: That have their alms out of the empress' chest.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: My lovely Aaron, wherefore look'st thou sad,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: When every thing doth make a gleeful boast?

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: The birds chant melody on every bush,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: The snake lies rolled in the cheerful sun,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: The green leaves quiver with the cooling wind

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And make a chequer'd shadow on the ground:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Under their sweet shade, Aaron, let us sit,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And, whilst the babbling echo mocks the hounds,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Replying shrilly to the well-tuned horns,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: As if a double hunt were heard at once,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Let us sit down and mark their yelping noise;

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And, after conflict such as was supposed

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: The wandering prince and Dido once enjoy'd,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: When with a happy storm they were surprised

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And curtain'd with a counsel-keeping cave,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: We may, each wreathed in the other's arms,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Our pastimes done, possess a golden slumber;

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Whiles hounds and horns and sweet melodious birds

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Be unto us as is a nurse's song

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Of lullaby to bring her babe asleep.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Madam, though Venus govern your desires,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Saturn is dominator over mine:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: What signifies my deadly-standing eye,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: My silence and my cloudy melancholy,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: My fleece of woolly hair that now uncurls

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Even as an adder when she doth unroll

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: To do some fatal execution?

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: No, madam, these are no venereal signs:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Vengeance is in my heart, death in my hand,
