scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Blood and revenge are hammering in my head.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Hark Tamora, the empress of my soul,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Which never hopes more heaven than rests in thee,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: This is the day of doom for Bassianus:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: His Philomel must lose her tongue to-day,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Thy sons make pillage of her chastity

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: And wash their hands in Bassianus' blood.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Seest thou this letter? take it up, I pray thee,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: And give the king this fatal plotted scroll.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Now question me no more; we are espied;

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Here comes a parcel of our hopeful booty,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Which dreads not yet their lives' destruction.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Ah, my sweet Moor, sweeter to me than life!

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: No more, great empress; Bassianus comes:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: Be cross with him; and I'll go fetch thy sons

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: To back thy quarrels, whatsoe'er they be.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Who have we here? Rome's royal empress,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Unfurnish'd of her well-beseeming troop?

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Or is it Dian, habited like her,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Who hath abandoned her holy groves

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: To see the general hunting in this forest?

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Saucy controller of our private steps!

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Had I the power that some say Dian had,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Thy temples should be planted presently

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: With horns, as was Actaeon's; and the hounds

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Should drive upon thy new-transformed limbs,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Unmannerly intruder as thou art!

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Under your patience, gentle empress,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: 'Tis thought you have a goodly gift in horning;

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: And to be doubted that your Moor and you

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Are singled forth to try experiments:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Jove shield your husband from his hounds to-day!

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: 'Tis pity they should take him for a stag.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Believe me, queen, your swarth Cimmerian

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Doth make your honour of his body's hue,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Spotted, detested, and abominable.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Why are you sequester'd from all your train,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Dismounted from your snow-white goodly steed.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: And wander'd hither to an obscure plot,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: Accompanied but with a barbarous Moor,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: If foul desire had not conducted you?

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: And, being intercepted in your sport,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Great reason that my noble lord be rated

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: For sauciness. I pray you, let us hence,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: And let her joy her raven-colour'd love;

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: This valley fits the purpose passing well.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: BASSIANUS
line: The king my brother shall have note of this.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Ay, for these slips have made him noted long:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Good king, to be so mightily abused!

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Why have I patience to endure all this?

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: How now, dear sovereign, and our gracious mother!

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Why doth your highness look so pale and wan?

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Have I not reason, think you, to look pale?

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: These two have 'ticed me hither to this place:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: A barren detested vale, you see it is;

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: The trees, though summer, yet forlorn and lean,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: O'ercome with moss and baleful mistletoe:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Here never shines the sun; here nothing breeds,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Unless the nightly owl or fatal raven:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And when they show'd me this abhorred pit,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: They told me, here, at dead time of the night,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: A thousand fiends, a thousand hissing snakes,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Ten thousand swelling toads, as many urchins,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Would make such fearful and confused cries

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: As any mortal body hearing it

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Should straight fall mad, or else die suddenly.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: No sooner had they told this hellish tale,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: But straight they told me they would bind me here

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Unto the body of a dismal yew,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And leave me to this miserable death:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And then they call'd me foul adulteress,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Lascivious Goth, and all the bitterest terms

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: That ever ear did hear to such effect:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And, had you not by wondrous fortune come,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: This vengeance on me had they executed.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Revenge it, as you love your mother's life,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Or be ye not henceforth call'd my children.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: This is a witness that I am thy son.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: CHIRON
line: And this for me, struck home to show my strength.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Ay, come, Semiramis, nay, barbarous Tamora,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: For no name fits thy nature but thy own!

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Give me thy poniard; you shall know, my boys

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Your mother's hand shall right your mother's wrong.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Stay, madam; here is more belongs to her;

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: First thrash the corn, then after burn the straw:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: This minion stood upon her chastity,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Upon her nuptial vow, her loyalty,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: And with that painted hope braves your mightiness:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: And shall she carry this unto her grave?

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: CHIRON
line: An if she do, I would I were an eunuch.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Drag hence her husband to some secret hole,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: CHIRON
line: And make his dead trunk pillow to our lust.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: But when ye have the honey ye desire,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Let not this wasp outlive, us both to sting.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: CHIRON
line: I warrant you, madam, we will make that sure.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Come, mistress, now perforce we will enjoy

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: CHIRON
line: That nice-preserved honesty of yours.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: O Tamora! thou bear'st a woman's face,--

speaker: TAMORA
line: I will not hear her speak; away with her!

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Sweet lords, entreat her hear me but a word.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Listen, fair madam: let it be your glory

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: To see her tears; but be your heart to them

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: As unrelenting flint to drops of rain.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: When did the tiger's young ones teach the dam?

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: O, do not learn her wrath; she taught it thee;

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: The milk thou suck'dst from her did turn to marble;

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Even at thy teat thou hadst thy tyranny.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Yet every mother breeds not sons alike:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Do thou entreat her show a woman pity.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: CHIRON
line: What, wouldst thou have me prove myself a bastard?

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: 'Tis true; the raven doth not hatch a lark:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Yet have I heard,--O, could I find it now!--

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: The lion moved with pity did endure

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: To have his princely paws pared all away:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Some say that ravens foster forlorn children,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: The whilst their own birds famish in their nests:

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: O, be to me, though thy hard heart say no,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Nothing so kind, but something pitiful!

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: I know not what it means; away with her!

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: O, let me teach thee! for my father's sake,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: That gave thee life, when well he might have

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Be not obdurate, open thy deaf ears.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Hadst thou in person ne'er offended me,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Even for his sake am I pitiless.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Remember, boys, I pour'd forth tears in vain,

speaker: TAMORA

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA

speaker: TAMORA
line: The worse to her, the better loved of me.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: O Tamora, be call'd a gentle queen,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: And with thine own hands kill me in this place!

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: For 'tis not life that I have begg'd so long;

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.

line: Poor I was slain when Bassianus died.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: What begg'st thou, then? fond woman, let me go.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: 'Tis present death I beg; and one thing more

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: That womanhood denies my tongue to tell:

speaker: LAVINIA

speaker: LAVINIA

speaker: LAVINIA

speaker: TAMORA
line: So should I rob my sweet sons of their fee:

speaker: LAVINIA

speaker: LAVINIA
line: The blot and enemy to our general name!

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: LAVINIA
line: Confusion fall--

line: Nay, then I'll stop your mouth. Bring thou her husband:

line: This is the hole where Aaron bid us hide him.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Farewell, my sons: see that you make her sure.

speaker: TAMORA
line: Ne'er let my heart know merry cheer indeed,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Till all the Andronici be made away.

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Now will I hence to seek my lovely Moor,

line: And let my spleenful sons this trull deflow'r.

speaker: AARON
line: Come on, my lords, the better foot before:

speaker: QUINTUS
line: My sight is very dull, whate'er it bodes.

line: And mine, I promise you; were't not for shame,

line: Well could I leave our sport to sleep awhile.

line: What art thou fall'n? What subtle hole is this,

line: Whose mouth is cover'd with rude-growing briers,

speaker: QUINTUS

speaker: QUINTUS
line: Speak, brother, hast thou hurt thee with the fall?

speaker: MARTIUS
line: O brother, with the dismall'st object hurt

line: That ever eye with sight made heart lament!

speaker: AARON
line: Aside  Now will I fetch the king to find them here,

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: AARON
line: That he thereby may give a likely guess

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.

line: How these were they that made away his brother.

speaker: MARTIUS
line: Why dost not comfort me, and help me out

speaker: MARTIUS
line: From this unhallowed and blood-stained hole?

speaker: QUINTUS
line: I am surprised with an uncouth fear;

line: A chilling sweat o'er-runs my trembling joints:

speaker: QUINTUS

scene: SCENE III.  A lonely part of the forest.
speaker: MARTIUS
line: To prove thou hast a true-divining heart,

speaker: QUINTUS

line: Lord Bassianus lies embrewed here,

speaker: QUINTUS

speaker: MARCUS
line: Shall I speak for thee? shall I say 'tis so?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: O, that I knew thy heart; and knew the beast,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: That I might rail at him, to ease my mind!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: Sorrow concealed, like an oven stopp'd,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: Doth burn the heart to cinders where it is.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: Fair Philomela, she but lost her tongue,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: And in a tedious sampler sew'd her mind:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: But, lovely niece, that mean is cut from thee;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: A craftier Tereus, cousin, hast thou met,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: And he hath cut those pretty fingers off,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: That could have better sew'd than Philomel.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: O, had the monster seen those lily hands

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: Tremble, like aspen-leaves, upon a lute,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: And make the silken strings delight to kiss them,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: He would not then have touch'd them for his life!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: Or, had he heard the heavenly harmony

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: Which that sweet tongue hath made,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: He would have dropp'd his knife, and fell asleep

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: As Cerberus at the Thracian poet's feet.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: Come, let us go, and make thy father blind;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: For such a sight will blind a father's eye:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: One hour's storm will drown the fragrant meads;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: What will whole months of tears thy father's eyes?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: Do not draw back, for we will mourn with thee

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the forest.
speaker: MARCUS
line: O, could our mourning ease thy misery!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Hear me, grave fathers! noble tribunes, stay!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For pity of mine age, whose youth was spent

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: In dangerous wars, whilst you securely slept;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For all my blood in Rome's great quarrel shed;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For all the frosty nights that I have watch'd;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And for these bitter tears, which now you see

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Filling the aged wrinkles in my cheeks;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Be pitiful to my condemned sons,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Whose souls are not corrupted as 'tis thought.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For two and twenty sons I never wept,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Because they died in honour's lofty bed.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For these, these, tribunes, in the dust I write

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: My heart's deep languor and my soul's sad tears:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Let my tears stanch the earth's dry appetite;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: My sons' sweet blood will make it shame and blush.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: O earth, I will befriend thee more with rain,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: That shall distil from these two ancient urns,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Than youthful April shall with all his showers:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: In summer's drought I'll drop upon thee still;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: In winter with warm tears I'll melt the snow

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And keep eternal spring-time on thy face,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: So thou refuse to drink my dear sons' blood.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: O reverend tribunes! O gentle, aged men!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Unbind my sons, reverse the doom of death;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And let me say, that never wept before,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: My tears are now prevailing orators.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: O noble father, you lament in vain:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: The tribunes hear you not; no man is by;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: And you recount your sorrows to a stone.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Ah, Lucius, for thy brothers let me plead.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Grave tribunes, once more I entreat of you,--

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: My gracious lord, no tribune hears you speak.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Why, tis no matter, man; if they did hear,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: They would not mark me, or if they did mark,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: They would not pity me, yet plead I must;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And bootless unto them.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Therefore I tell my sorrows to the stones;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Who, though they cannot answer my distress,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Yet in some sort they are better than the tribunes,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For that they will not intercept my tale:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: When I do weep, they humbly at my feet

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Receive my tears and seem to weep with me;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And, were they but attired in grave weeds,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Rome could afford no tribune like to these.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: A stone is soft as wax,--tribunes more hard than stones;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: A stone is silent, and offendeth not,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And tribunes with their tongues doom men to death.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But wherefore stand'st thou with thy weapon drawn?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: To rescue my two brothers from their death:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: For which attempt the judges have pronounced

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: My everlasting doom of banishment.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: O happy man! they have befriended thee.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Why, foolish Lucius, dost thou not perceive

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: That Rome is but a wilderness of tigers?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Tigers must prey, and Rome affords no prey

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But me and mine: how happy art thou, then,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: From these devourers to be banished!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But who comes with our brother Marcus here?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Titus, prepare thy aged eyes to weep;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Or, if not so, thy noble heart to break:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: I bring consuming sorrow to thine age.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Will it consume me? let me see it, then.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: This was thy daughter.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Why, Marcus, so she is.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Ay me, this object kills me!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Faint-hearted boy, arise, and look upon her.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Speak, Lavinia, what accursed hand

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Hath made thee handless in thy father's sight?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: What fool hath added water to the sea,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Or brought a faggot to bright-burning Troy?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: My grief was at the height before thou camest,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And now like Nilus, it disdaineth bounds.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Give me a sword, I'll chop off my hands too;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For they have fought for Rome, and all in vain;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And they have nursed this woe, in feeding life;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: In bootless prayer have they been held up,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And they have served me to effectless use:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Now all the service I require of them

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Is that the one will help to cut the other.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: 'Tis well, Lavinia, that thou hast no hands;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For hands, to do Rome service, are but vain.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Speak, gentle sister, who hath martyr'd thee?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: O, that delightful engine of her thoughts

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: That blabb'd them with such pleasing eloquence,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Is torn from forth that pretty hollow cage,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Where, like a sweet melodious bird, it sung

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Sweet varied notes, enchanting every ear!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: O, say thou for her, who hath done this deed?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: O, thus I found her, straying in the park,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Seeking to hide herself, as doth the deer

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: That hath received some unrecuring wound.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: It was my deer; and he that wounded her

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Hath hurt me more than had he killed me dead:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For now I stand as one upon a rock

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Environed with a wilderness of sea,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Who marks the waxing tide grow wave by wave,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Expecting ever when some envious surge

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Will in his brinish bowels swallow him.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: This way to death my wretched sons are gone;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Here stands my other son, a banished man,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And here my brother, weeping at my woes.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But that which gives my soul the greatest spurn,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Is dear Lavinia, dearer than my soul.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Had I but seen thy picture in this plight,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: It would have madded me: what shall I do

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Now I behold thy lively body so?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thou hast no hands, to wipe away thy tears:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Nor tongue, to tell me who hath martyr'd thee:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thy husband he is dead: and for his death

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thy brothers are condemn'd, and dead by this.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Look, Marcus! ah, son Lucius, look on her!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: When I did name her brothers, then fresh tears

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Stood on her cheeks, as doth the honey-dew

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Upon a gather'd lily almost wither'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Perchance she weeps because they kill'd her husband;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Perchance because she knows them innocent.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: If they did kill thy husband, then be joyful

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Because the law hath ta'en revenge on them.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: No, no, they would not do so foul a deed;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Witness the sorrow that their sister makes.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Gentle Lavinia, let me kiss thy lips.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Or make some sign how I may do thee ease:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Shall thy good uncle, and thy brother Lucius,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And thou, and I, sit round about some fountain,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Looking all downwards to behold our cheeks

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: How they are stain'd, as meadows, yet not dry,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: With miry slime left on them by a flood?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And in the fountain shall we gaze so long

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Till the fresh taste be taken from that clearness,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And made a brine-pit with our bitter tears?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Or shall we cut away our hands, like thine?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Or shall we bite our tongues, and in dumb shows

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Pass the remainder of our hateful days?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: What shall we do? let us, that have our tongues,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Plot some deuce of further misery,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To make us wonder'd at in time to come.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Sweet father, cease your tears; for, at your grief,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: See how my wretched sister sobs and weeps.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Patience, dear niece. Good Titus, dry thine eyes.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Ah, Marcus, Marcus! brother, well I wot

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thy napkin cannot drink a tear of mine,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For thou, poor man, hast drown'd it with thine own.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Ah, my Lavinia, I will wipe thy cheeks.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Mark, Marcus, mark! I understand her signs:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Had she a tongue to speak, now would she say

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: That to her brother which I said to thee:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: His napkin, with his true tears all bewet,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Can do no service on her sorrowful cheeks.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: O, what a sympathy of woe is this,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: As far from help as Limbo is from bliss!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: Titus Andronicus, my lord the emperor

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: Sends thee this word,--that, if thou love thy sons,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: Let Marcus, Lucius, or thyself, old Titus,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: Or any one of you, chop off your hand,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: And send it to the king: he for the same

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: Will send thee hither both thy sons alive;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: And that shall be the ransom for their fault.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: O gracious emperor! O gentle Aaron!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Did ever raven sing so like a lark,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: That gives sweet tidings of the sun's uprise?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: With all my heart, I'll send the emperor My hand:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Good Aaron, wilt thou help to chop it off?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Stay, father! for that noble hand of thine,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: That hath thrown down so many enemies,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Shall not be sent: my hand will serve the turn:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: My youth can better spare my blood than you;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: And therefore mine shall save my brothers' lives.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Which of your hands hath not defended Rome,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And rear'd aloft the bloody battle-axe,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Writing destruction on the enemy's castle?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: O, none of both but are of high desert:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: My hand hath been but idle; let it serve

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: To ransom my two nephews from their death;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Then have I kept it to a worthy end.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: Nay, come, agree whose hand shall go along,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: For fear they die before their pardon come.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: My hand shall go.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: By heaven, it shall not go!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Sirs, strive no more: such wither'd herbs as these

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Are meet for plucking up, and therefore mine.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Sweet father, if I shall be thought thy son,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Let me redeem my brothers both from death.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And, for our father's sake and mother's care,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Now let me show a brother's love to thee.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Agree between you; I will spare my hand.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Then I'll go fetch an axe.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: But I will use the axe.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Come hither, Aaron; I'll deceive them both:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lend me thy hand, and I will give thee mine.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: Aside  If that be call'd deceit, I will be honest,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: And never, whilst I live, deceive men so:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: But I'll deceive you in another sort,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: And that you'll say, ere half an hour pass.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Now stay your strife: what shall be is dispatch'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Good Aaron, give his majesty my hand:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Tell him it was a hand that warded him

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: From thousand dangers; bid him bury it

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: More hath it merited; that let it have.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: As for my sons, say I account of them

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: As jewels purchased at an easy price;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And yet dear too, because I bought mine own.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: I go, Andronicus: and for thy hand

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: Look by and by to have thy sons with thee.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: Their heads, I mean. O, how this villany

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: Doth fat me with the very thoughts of it!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: Let fools do good, and fair men call for grace.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: AARON
line: Aaron will have his soul black like his face.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: O, here I lift this one hand up to heaven,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And bow this feeble ruin to the earth:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: If any power pities wretched tears,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To that I call!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: What, wilt thou kneel with me?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Do, then, dear heart; for heaven shall hear our prayers;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Or with our sighs we'll breathe the welkin dim,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And stain the sun with fog, as sometime clouds

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: When they do hug him in their melting bosoms.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: O brother, speak with possibilities,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And do not break into these deep extremes.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Is not my sorrow deep, having no bottom?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Then be my passions bottomless with them.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: But yet let reason govern thy lament.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: If there were reason for these miseries,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Then into limits could I bind my woes:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: When heaven doth weep, doth not the earth o'erflow?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: If the winds rage, doth not the sea wax mad,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Threatening the welkin with his big-swoln face?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And wilt thou have a reason for this coil?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I am the sea; hark, how her sighs do blow!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: She is the weeping welkin, I the earth:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Then must my sea be moved with her sighs;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Then must my earth with her continual tears

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Become a deluge, overflow'd and drown'd;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For why my bowels cannot hide her woes,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But like a drunkard must I vomit them.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Then give me leave, for losers will have leave

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To ease their stomachs with their bitter tongues.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: Messenger
line: Worthy Andronicus, ill art thou repaid

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: Messenger
line: For that good hand thou sent'st the emperor.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: Messenger
line: Here are the heads of thy two noble sons;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: Messenger
line: And here's thy hand, in scorn to thee sent back;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: Messenger
line: Thy griefs their sports, thy resolution mock'd;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: Messenger
line: That woe is me to think upon thy woes

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: Messenger
line: More than remembrance of my father's death.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Now let hot AEtna cool in Sicily,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And be my heart an ever-burning hell!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: These miseries are more than may be borne.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: To weep with them that weep doth ease some deal;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: But sorrow flouted at is double death.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Ah, that this sight should make so deep a wound,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: And yet detested life not shrink thereat!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: That ever death should let life bear his name,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Where life hath no more interest but to breathe!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Alas, poor heart, that kiss is comfortless

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: As frozen water to a starved snake.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: When will this fearful slumber have an end?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Now, farewell, flattery: die, Andronicus;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thou dost not slumber: see, thy two sons' heads,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thy warlike hand, thy mangled daughter here:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thy other banish'd son, with this dear sight

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Struck pale and bloodless; and thy brother, I,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Even like a stony image, cold and numb.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Ah, now no more will I control thy griefs:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Rend off thy silver hair, thy other hand

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Gnawing with thy teeth; and be this dismal sight

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: The closing up of our most wretched eyes;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Now is a time to storm; why art thou still?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Ha, ha, ha!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Why dost thou laugh? it fits not with this hour.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Why, I have not another tear to shed:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Besides, this sorrow is an enemy,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And would usurp upon my watery eyes

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And make them blind with tributary tears:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Then which way shall I find Revenge's cave?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For these two heads do seem to speak to me,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And threat me I shall never come to bliss

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Till all these mischiefs be return'd again

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Even in their throats that have committed them.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Come, let me see what task I have to do.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: You heavy people, circle me about,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: That I may turn me to each one of you,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And swear unto my soul to right your wrongs.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: The vow is made. Come, brother, take a head;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And in this hand the other I will bear.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lavinia, thou shalt be employ'd: these arms!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Bear thou my hand, sweet wench, between thy teeth.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: As for thee, boy, go get thee from my sight;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thou art an exile, and thou must not stay:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Hie to the Goths, and raise an army there:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And, if you love me, as I think you do,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Let's kiss and part, for we have much to do.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Farewell Andronicus, my noble father,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: The wofull'st man that ever lived in Rome:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Farewell, proud Rome; till Lucius come again,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: He leaves his pledges dearer than his life:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Farewell, Lavinia, my noble sister;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: O, would thou wert as thou tofore hast been!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: But now nor Lucius nor Lavinia lives

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: But in oblivion and hateful griefs.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: If Lucius live, he will requite your wrongs;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: And make proud Saturnine and his empress

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Beg at the gates, like Tarquin and his queen.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Now will I to the Goths, and raise a power,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. A street.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: To be revenged on Rome and Saturnine.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: So, so; now sit: and look you eat no more

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Than will preserve just so much strength in us

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: As will revenge these bitter woes of ours.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Marcus, unknit that sorrow-wreathen knot:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thy niece and I, poor creatures, want our hands,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And cannot passionate our tenfold grief

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: With folded arms. This poor right hand of mine

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Is left to tyrannize upon my breast;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Who, when my heart, all mad with misery,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Beats in this hollow prison of my flesh,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Then thus I thump it down.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thou map of woe, that thus dost talk in signs!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: When thy poor heart beats with outrageous beating,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thou canst not strike it thus to make it still.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Wound it with sighing, girl, kill it with groans;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Or get some little knife between thy teeth,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And just against thy heart make thou a hole;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: That all the tears that thy poor eyes let fall

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: May run into that sink, and soaking in

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Drown the lamenting fool in sea-salt tears.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Fie, brother, fie! teach her not thus to lay

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Such violent hands upon her tender life.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: How now! has sorrow made thee dote already?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Why, Marcus, no man should be mad but I.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: What violent hands can she lay on her life?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Ah, wherefore dost thou urge the name of hands;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To bid AEneas tell the tale twice o'er,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: How Troy was burnt and he made miserable?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: O, handle not the theme, to talk of hands,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lest we remember still that we have none.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Fie, fie, how franticly I square my talk,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: As if we should forget we had no hands,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: If Marcus did not name the word of hands!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Come, let's fall to; and, gentle girl, eat this:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Here is no drink! Hark, Marcus, what she says;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I can interpret all her martyr'd signs;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: She says she drinks no other drink but tears,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Brew'd with her sorrow, mesh'd upon her cheeks:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Speechless complainer, I will learn thy thought;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: In thy dumb action will I be as perfect

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: As begging hermits in their holy prayers:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thou shalt not sigh, nor hold thy stumps to heaven,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Nor wink, nor nod, nor kneel, nor make a sign,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But I of these will wrest an alphabet

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And by still practise learn to know thy meaning.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Good grandsire, leave these bitter deep laments:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Make my aunt merry with some pleasing tale.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Alas, the tender boy, in passion moved,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Doth weep to see his grandsire's heaviness.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Peace, tender sapling; thou art made of tears,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And tears will quickly melt thy life away.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: What dost thou strike at, Marcus, with thy knife?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: At that that I have kill'd, my lord; a fly.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Out on thee, murderer! thou kill'st my heart;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Mine eyes are cloy'd with view of tyranny:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: A deed of death done on the innocent

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Becomes not Titus' brother: get thee gone:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I see thou art not for my company.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Alas, my lord, I have but kill'd a fly.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But how, if that fly had a father and mother?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: How would he hang his slender gilded wings,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And buzz lamenting doings in the air!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Poor harmless fly,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: That, with his pretty buzzing melody,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Came here to make us merry! and thou hast

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: kill'd him.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Pardon me, sir; it was a black ill-favor'd fly,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Like to the empress' Moor; therefore I kill'd him.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: O, O, O,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Then pardon me for reprehending thee,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For thou hast done a charitable deed.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Give me thy knife, I will insult on him;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Flattering myself, as if it were the Moor

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Come hither purposely to poison me.--

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: There's for thyself, and that's for Tamora.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Ah, sirrah!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Yet, I think, we are not brought so low,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But that between us we can kill a fly

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: That comes in likeness of a coal-black Moor.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Alas, poor man! grief has so wrought on him,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: He takes false shadows for true substances.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Come, take away. Lavinia, go with me:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I'll to thy closet; and go read with thee

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Sad stories chanced in the times of old.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Come, boy, and go with me: thy sight is young,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in Titus's house. A banquet set out.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And thou shalt read when mine begin to dazzle.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Help, grandsire, help! my aunt Lavinia

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Follows me every where, I know not why:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Good uncle Marcus, see how swift she comes.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Alas, sweet aunt, I know not what you mean.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Stand by me, Lucius; do not fear thine aunt.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: She loves thee, boy, too well to do thee harm.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Ay, when my father was in Rome she did.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: What means my niece Lavinia by these signs?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Fear her not, Lucius: somewhat doth she mean:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: See, Lucius, see how much she makes of thee:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Somewhither would she have thee go with her.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Ah, boy, Cornelia never with more care

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Read to her sons than she hath read to thee

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Sweet poetry and Tully's Orator.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Canst thou not guess wherefore she plies thee thus?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: My lord, I know not, I, nor can I guess,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Unless some fit or frenzy do possess her:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: For I have heard my grandsire say full oft,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Extremity of griefs would make men mad;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: And I have read that Hecuba of Troy

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Ran mad through sorrow: that made me to fear;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Although, my lord, I know my noble aunt

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Loves me as dear as e'er my mother did,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: And would not, but in fury, fright my youth:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Which made me down to throw my books, and fly--

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Causeless, perhaps. But pardon me, sweet aunt:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: And, madam, if my uncle Marcus go,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: I will most willingly attend your ladyship.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lucius, I will.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: How now, Lavinia! Marcus, what means this?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Some book there is that she desires to see.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Which is it, girl, of these? Open them, boy.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But thou art deeper read, and better skill'd

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Come, and take choice of all my library,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And so beguile thy sorrow, till the heavens

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Reveal the damn'd contriver of this deed.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Why lifts she up her arms in sequence thus?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: I think she means that there was more than one

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Confederate in the fact: ay, more there was;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Or else to heaven she heaves them for revenge.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lucius, what book is that she tosseth so?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Grandsire, 'tis Ovid's Metamorphoses;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: My mother gave it me.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: For love of her that's gone,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Perhaps she cull'd it from among the rest.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Soft! see how busily she turns the leaves!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: What would she find? Lavinia, shall I read?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: This is the tragic tale of Philomel,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And treats of Tereus' treason and his rape:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And rape, I fear, was root of thine annoy.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: See, brother, see; note how she quotes the leaves.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lavinia, wert thou thus surprised, sweet girl,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Ravish'd and wrong'd, as Philomela was,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Forced in the ruthless, vast, and gloomy woods? See, see!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Ay, such a place there is, where we did hunt--

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: O, had we never, never hunted there!--

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Pattern'd by that the poet here describes,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: By nature made for murders and for rapes.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: O, why should nature build so foul a den,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Unless the gods delight in tragedies?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Give signs, sweet girl, for here are none

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: but friends,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: What Roman lord it was durst do the deed:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Or slunk not Saturnine, as Tarquin erst,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: That left the camp to sin in Lucrece' bed?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Sit down, sweet niece: brother, sit down by me.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Apollo, Pallas, Jove, or Mercury,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Inspire me, that I may this treason find!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: My lord, look here: look here, Lavinia:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: This sandy plot is plain; guide, if thou canst

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: This after me, when I have writ my name

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Without the help of any hand at all.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Cursed be that heart that forced us to this shift!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Write thou good niece; and here display, at last,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: What God will have discover'd for revenge;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Heaven guide thy pen to print thy sorrows plain,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: That we may know the traitors and the truth!

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: O, do ye read, my lord, what she hath writ?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: 'Stuprum. Chiron. Demetrius.'

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: What, what! the lustful sons of Tamora

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Performers of this heinous, bloody deed?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Magni Dominator poli,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Tam lentus audis scelera? tam lentus vides?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: O, calm thee, gentle lord; although I know

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: There is enough written upon this earth

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: To stir a mutiny in the mildest thoughts

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And arm the minds of infants to exclaims.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: My lord, kneel down with me; Lavinia, kneel;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And kneel, sweet boy, the Roman Hector's hope;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And swear with me, as, with the woful fere

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And father of that chaste dishonour'd dame,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lord Junius Brutus sware for Lucrece' rape,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: That we will prosecute by good advice

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Mortal revenge upon these traitorous Goths,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And see their blood, or die with this reproach.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: 'Tis sure enough, an you knew how.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But if you hunt these bear-whelps, then beware:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: The dam will wake; and, if she wind you once,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: She's with the lion deeply still in league,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And lulls him whilst she playeth on her back,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And when he sleeps will she do what she list.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: You are a young huntsman, Marcus; let it alone;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And, come, I will go get a leaf of brass,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And with a gad of steel will write these words,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And lay it by: the angry northern wind

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Will blow these sands, like Sibyl's leaves, abroad,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And where's your lesson, then? Boy, what say you?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: I say, my lord, that if I were a man,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Their mother's bed-chamber should not be safe

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: For these bad bondmen to the yoke of Rome.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Ay, that's my boy! thy father hath full oft

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: For his ungrateful country done the like.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: And, uncle, so will I, an if I live.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Come, go with me into mine armoury;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lucius, I'll fit thee; and withal, my boy,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Shalt carry from me to the empress' sons

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Presents that I intend to send them both:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Come, come; thou'lt do thy message, wilt thou not?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Ay, with my dagger in their bosoms, grandsire.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: No, boy, not so; I'll teach thee another course.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lavinia, come. Marcus, look to my house:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lucius and I'll go brave it at the court:

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Ay, marry, will we, sir; and we'll be waited on.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: O heavens, can you hear a good man groan,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And not relent, or not compassion him?

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Marcus, attend him in his ecstasy,

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: That hath more scars of sorrow in his heart

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Than foemen's marks upon his batter'd shield;

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: But yet so just that he will not revenge.

scene: SCENE I.  Rome. Titus's garden.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Revenge, ye heavens, for old Andronicus!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Demetrius, here's the son of Lucius;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: He hath some message to deliver us.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Ay, some mad message from his mad grandfather.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: My lords, with all the humbleness I may,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: I greet your honours from Andronicus.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: And pray the Roman gods confound you both!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Gramercy, lovely Lucius: what's the news?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Aside  That you are both decipher'd, that's the news,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
