speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: For villains mark'd with rape.--May it please you,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: My grandsire, well advised, hath sent by me

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: The goodliest weapons of his armoury

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: To gratify your honourable youth,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: The hope of Rome; for so he bade me say;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: And so I do, and with his gifts present

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: Your lordships, that, whenever you have need,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: You may be armed and appointed well:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: And so I leave you both:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Young LUCIUS
line: like bloody villains.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: What's here? A scroll; and written round about?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Let's see;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: 'Integer vitae, scelerisque purus,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Non eget Mauri jaculis, nec arcu.'

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: O, 'tis a verse in Horace; I know it well:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: I read it in the grammar long ago.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Ay, just; a verse in Horace; right, you have it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Now, what a thing it is to be an ass!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Here's no sound jest! the old man hath found their guilt;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And sends them weapons wrapped about with lines,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: That wound, beyond their feeling, to the quick.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: But were our witty empress well afoot,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: She would applaud Andronicus' conceit:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: But let her rest in her unrest awhile.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And now, young lords, was't not a happy star

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Led us to Rome, strangers, and more than so,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Captives, to be advanced to this height?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: It did me good, before the palace gate

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: To brave the tribune in his brother's hearing.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: But me more good, to see so great a lord

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Basely insinuate and send us gifts.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Had he not reason, Lord Demetrius?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Did you not use his daughter very friendly?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: I would we had a thousand Roman dames

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: At such a bay, by turn to serve our lust.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: A charitable wish and full of love.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Here lacks but your mother for to say amen.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: And that would she for twenty thousand more.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Come, let us go; and pray to all the gods

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: For our beloved mother in her pains.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Aside  Pray to the devils; the gods have given us over.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Why do the emperor's trumpets flourish thus?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Belike, for joy the emperor hath a son.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Soft! who comes here?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: Good morrow, lords:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: O, tell me, did you see Aaron the Moor?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Well, more or less, or ne'er a whit at all,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Here Aaron is; and what with Aaron now?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: O gentle Aaron, we are all undone!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: Now help, or woe betide thee evermore!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Why, what a caterwauling dost thou keep!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: What dost thou wrap and fumble in thine arms?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: O, that which I would hide from heaven's eye,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: Our empress' shame, and stately Rome's disgrace!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: She is deliver'd, lords; she is deliver'd.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: To whom?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: I mean, she is brought a-bed.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Well, God give her good rest! What hath he sent her?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: A devil.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Why, then she is the devil's dam; a joyful issue.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: A joyless, dismal, black, and sorrowful issue:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: Here is the babe, as loathsome as a toad

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: Amongst the fairest breeders of our clime:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: The empress sends it thee, thy stamp, thy seal,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: And bids thee christen it with thy dagger's point.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: 'Zounds, ye whore! is black so base a hue?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Sweet blowse, you are a beauteous blossom, sure.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Villain, what hast thou done?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: That which thou canst not undo.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Thou hast undone our mother.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Villain, I have done thy mother.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: And therein, hellish dog, thou hast undone.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Woe to her chance, and damn'd her loathed choice!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Accursed the offspring of so foul a fiend!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: It shall not live.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: It shall not die.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: Aaron, it must; the mother wills it so.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: What, must it, nurse? then let no man but I

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Do execution on my flesh and blood.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: I'll broach the tadpole on my rapier's point:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Nurse, give it me; my sword shall soon dispatch it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Sooner this sword shall plough thy bowels up.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Stay, murderous villains! will you kill your brother?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Now, by the burning tapers of the sky,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: That shone so brightly when this boy was got,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: He dies upon my scimitar's sharp point

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: That touches this my first-born son and heir!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: I tell you, younglings, not Enceladus,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: With all his threatening band of Typhon's brood,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Nor great Alcides, nor the god of war,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Shall seize this prey out of his father's hands.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: What, what, ye sanguine, shallow-hearted boys!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Ye white-limed walls! ye alehouse painted signs!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Coal-black is better than another hue,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: In that it scorns to bear another hue;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: For all the water in the ocean

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Can never turn the swan's black legs to white,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Although she lave them hourly in the flood.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Tell the empress from me, I am of age

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: To keep mine own, excuse it how she can.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Wilt thou betray thy noble mistress thus?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: My mistress is my mistress; this myself,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: The vigour and the picture of my youth:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: This before all the world do I prefer;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: This maugre all the world will I keep safe,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Or some of you shall smoke for it in Rome.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: By this our mother is forever shamed.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Rome will despise her for this foul escape.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: The emperor, in his rage, will doom her death.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: I blush to think upon this ignomy.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Why, there's the privilege your beauty bears:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Fie, treacherous hue, that will betray with blushing

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: The close enacts and counsels of the heart!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Here's a young lad framed of another leer:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Look, how the black slave smiles upon the father,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: As who should say 'Old lad, I am thine own.'

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: He is your brother, lords, sensibly fed

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Of that self-blood that first gave life to you,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And from that womb where you imprison'd were

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: He is enfranchised and come to light:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Nay, he is your brother by the surer side,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Although my seal be stamped in his face.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: Aaron, what shall I say unto the empress?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Advise thee, Aaron, what is to be done,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: And we will all subscribe to thy advice:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Save thou the child, so we may all be safe.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Then sit we down, and let us all consult.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: My son and I will have the wind of you:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Keep there: now talk at pleasure of your safety.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: How many women saw this child of his?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Why, so, brave lords! when we join in league,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: I am a lamb: but if you brave the Moor,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: The chafed boar, the mountain lioness,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: The ocean swells not so as Aaron storms.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: But say, again; how many saw the child?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: Cornelia the midwife and myself;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: Nurse
line: And no one else but the deliver'd empress.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: The empress, the midwife, and yourself:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Two may keep counsel when the third's away:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Go to the empress, tell her this I said.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Weke, weke! so cries a pig prepared to the spit.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: What mean'st thou, Aaron? wherefore didst thou this?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: O Lord, sir, 'tis a deed of policy:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Shall she live to betray this guilt of ours,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: A long-tongued babbling gossip? no, lords, no:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And now be it known to you my full intent.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Not far, one Muli lives, my countryman;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: His wife but yesternight was brought to bed;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: His child is like to her, fair as you are:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Go pack with him, and give the mother gold,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And tell them both the circumstance of all;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And how by this their child shall be advanced,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And be received for the emperor's heir,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And substituted in the place of mine,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: To calm this tempest whirling in the court;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And let the emperor dandle him for his own.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Hark ye, lords; ye see I have given her physic,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And you must needs bestow her funeral;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: The fields are near, and you are gallant grooms:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: This done, see that you take no longer days,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: But send the midwife presently to me.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: The midwife and the nurse well made away,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Then let the ladies tattle what they please.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Aaron, I see thou wilt not trust the air

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: CHIRON
line: With secrets.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: For this care of Tamora,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Herself and hers are highly bound to thee.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Now to the Goths, as swift as swallow flies;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: There to dispose this treasure in mine arms,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And secretly to greet the empress' friends.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: Come on, you thick lipp'd slave, I'll bear you hence;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: For it is you that puts us to our shifts:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: I'll make you feed on berries and on roots,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And feed on curds and whey, and suck the goat,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: And cabin in a cave, and bring you up

scene: SCENE II.  The same. A room in the palace.
speaker: AARON
line: To be a warrior, and command a camp.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Come, Marcus; come, kinsmen; this is the way.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Sir boy, now let me see your archery;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Look ye draw home enough, and 'tis there straight.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Terras Astraea reliquit:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Be you remember'd, Marcus, she's gone, she's fled.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Sirs, take you to your tools. You, cousins, shall

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Go sound the ocean, and cast your nets;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Happily you may catch her in the sea;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Yet there's as little justice as at land:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: No; Publius and Sempronius, you must do it;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: 'Tis you must dig with mattock and with spade,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And pierce the inmost centre of the earth:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Then, when you come to Pluto's region,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I pray you, deliver him this petition;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Tell him, it is for justice and for aid,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And that it comes from old Andronicus,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Shaken with sorrows in ungrateful Rome.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Ah, Rome! Well, well; I made thee miserable

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: What time I threw the people's suffrages

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: On him that thus doth tyrannize o'er me.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Go, get you gone; and pray be careful all,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And leave you not a man-of-war unsearch'd:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: This wicked emperor may have shipp'd her hence;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And, kinsmen, then we may go pipe for justice.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: O Publius, is not this a heavy case,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: To see thy noble uncle thus distract?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: PUBLIUS
line: Therefore, my lord, it highly us concerns

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: PUBLIUS
line: By day and night to attend him carefully,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: PUBLIUS
line: And feed his humour kindly as we may,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: PUBLIUS
line: Till time beget some careful remedy.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Kinsmen, his sorrows are past remedy.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Join with the Goths; and with revengeful war

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Take wreak on Rome for this ingratitude,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.

line: And vengeance on the traitor Saturnine.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Publius, how now! how now, my masters!

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: What, have you met with her?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: PUBLIUS
line: No, my good lord; but Pluto sends you word,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: PUBLIUS
line: If you will have Revenge from hell, you shall:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: PUBLIUS
line: Marry, for Justice, she is so employ'd,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: PUBLIUS
line: He thinks, with Jove in heaven, or somewhere else,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: PUBLIUS
line: So that perforce you must needs stay a time.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: He doth me wrong to feed me with delays.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I'll dive into the burning lake below,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And pull her out of Acheron by the heels.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Marcus, we are but shrubs, no cedars we

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: No big-boned men framed of the Cyclops' size;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But metal, Marcus, steel to the very back,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Yet wrung with wrongs more than our backs can bear:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And, sith there's no justice in earth nor hell,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: We will solicit heaven and move the gods

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To send down Justice for to wreak our wrongs.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Come, to this gear. You are a good archer, Marcus;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: 'Ad Jovem,' that's for you: here, 'Ad Apollinem:'

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: 'Ad Martem,' that's for myself:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Here, boy, to Pallas: here, to Mercury:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To Saturn, Caius, not to Saturnine;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: You were as good to shoot against the wind.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To it, boy! Marcus, loose when I bid.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Of my word, I have written to effect;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: There's not a god left unsolicited.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Kinsmen, shoot all your shafts into the court:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: We will afflict the emperor in his pride.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Now, masters, draw.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: O, well said, Lucius!

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Good boy, in Virgo's lap; give it Pallas.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: My lord, I aim a mile beyond the moon;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Your letter is with Jupiter by this.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Ha, ha!

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Publius, Publius, what hast thou done?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: See, see, thou hast shot off one of Taurus' horns.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: This was the sport, my lord: when Publius shot,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: The Bull, being gall'd, gave Aries such a knock

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: That down fell both the Ram's horns in the court;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: And who should find them but the empress' villain?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: She laugh'd, and told the Moor he should not choose

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: But give them to his master for a present.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Why, there it goes: God give his lordship joy!

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: News, news from heaven! Marcus, the post is come.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Sirrah, what tidings? have you any letters?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Shall I have justice? what says Jupiter?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: Clown
line: O, the gibbet-maker! he says that he hath taken

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: Clown
line: them down again, for the man must not be hanged till

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: Clown
line: the next week.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But what says Jupiter, I ask thee?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: Clown
line: Alas, sir, I know not Jupiter; I never drank with him

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: Clown
line: in all my life.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Why, villain, art not thou the carrier?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: Clown
line: Ay, of my pigeons, sir; nothing else.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Why, didst thou not come from heaven?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: Clown
line: From heaven! alas, sir, I never came there     God

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: Clown
line: forbid I should be so bold to press to heaven in my

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: Clown
line: young days. Why, I am going with my pigeons to the

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: Clown
line: tribunal plebs, to take up a matter of brawl

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: Clown
line: betwixt my uncle and one of the emperial's men.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: Why, sir, that is as fit as can be to serve for

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: your oration; and let him deliver the pigeons to

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: the emperor from you.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Tell me, can you deliver an oration to the emperor

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: with a grace?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: Clown
line: Nay, truly, sir, I could never say grace in all my life.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Sirrah, come hither: make no more ado,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But give your pigeons to the emperor:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: By me thou shalt have justice at his hands.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Hold, hold; meanwhile here's money for thy charges.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Give me pen and ink. Sirrah, can you with a grace

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: deliver a supplication?

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: Clown
line: Ay, sir.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Then here is a supplication for you. And when you

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: come to him, at the first approach you must kneel,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: then kiss his foot, then deliver up your pigeons, and

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: then look for your reward. I'll be at hand, sir; see

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: you do it bravely.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: Clown
line: I warrant you, sir, let me alone.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Sirrah, hast thou a knife? come, let me see it.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Here, Marcus, fold it in the oration;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For thou hast made it like an humble suppliant.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And when thou hast given it the emperor,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Knock at my door, and tell me what he says.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: Clown
line: God be with you, sir; I will.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. A public place.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Come, Marcus, let us go. Publius, follow me.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Why, lords, what wrongs are these! was ever seen

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: An emperor in Rome thus overborne,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Troubled, confronted thus; and, for the extent

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Of egal justice, used in such contempt?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: My lords, you know, as know the mightful gods,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: However these disturbers of our peace

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Buz in the people's ears, there nought hath pass'd,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: But even with law, against the willful sons

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Of old Andronicus. And what an if

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: His sorrows have so overwhelm'd his wits,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Shall we be thus afflicted in his wreaks,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: His fits, his frenzy, and his bitterness?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And now he writes to heaven for his redress:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: See, here's to Jove, and this to Mercury;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: This to Apollo; this to the god of war;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Sweet scrolls to fly about the streets of Rome!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: What's this but libelling against the senate,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And blazoning our injustice every where?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: A goodly humour, is it not, my lords?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: As who would say, in Rome no justice were.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: But if I live, his feigned ecstasies

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Shall be no shelter to these outrages:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: But he and his shall know that justice lives

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: In Saturninus' health, whom, if she sleep,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: He'll so awake as she in fury shall

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Cut off the proud'st conspirator that lives.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: My gracious lord, my lovely Saturnine,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Lord of my life, commander of my thoughts,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Calm thee, and bear the faults of Titus' age,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: The effects of sorrow for his valiant sons,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Whose loss hath pierced him deep and scarr'd his heart;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And rather comfort his distressed plight

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Than prosecute the meanest or the best

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: For these contempts.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Why, thus it shall become

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: High-witted Tamora to gloze with all:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: But, Titus, I have touched thee to the quick,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Thy life-blood out: if Aaron now be wise,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Then is all safe, the anchor's in the port.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: How now, good fellow! wouldst thou speak with us?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: Clown
line: Yea, forsooth, an your mistership be emperial.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Empress I am, but yonder sits the emperor.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: Clown
line: 'Tis he. God and Saint Stephen give you good den:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: Clown
line: I have brought you a letter and a couple of pigeons here.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Go, take him away, and hang him presently.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: Clown
line: How much money must I have?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Come, sirrah, you must be hanged.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: Clown
line: Hanged! by'r lady, then I have brought up a neck to

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: Clown
line: a fair end.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Despiteful and intolerable wrongs!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Shall I endure this monstrous villany?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: I know from whence this same device proceeds:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: May this be borne?--as if his traitorous sons,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: That died by law for murder of our brother,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Have by my means been butcher'd wrongfully!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Go, drag the villain hither by the hair;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Nor age nor honour shall shape privilege:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: For this proud mock I'll be thy slaughterman;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Sly frantic wretch, that holp'st to make me great,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: In hope thyself should govern Rome and me.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: What news with thee, AEmilius?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: AEMILIUS
line: Arm, arm, my lord;--Rome never had more cause.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: AEMILIUS
line: The Goths have gather'd head; and with a power

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: AEMILIUS
line: high-resolved men, bent to the spoil,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: AEMILIUS
line: They hither march amain, under conduct

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: AEMILIUS
line: Of Lucius, son to old Andronicus;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: AEMILIUS
line: Who threats, in course of this revenge, to do

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: AEMILIUS
line: As much as ever Coriolanus did.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Is warlike Lucius general of the Goths?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: These tidings nip me, and I hang the head

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: As flowers with frost or grass beat down with storms:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Ay, now begin our sorrows to approach:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: 'Tis he the common people love so much;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Myself hath often over-heard them say,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: When I have walked like a private man,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: That Lucius' banishment was wrongfully,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And they have wish'd that Lucius were their emperor.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Why should you fear? is not your city strong?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Ay, but the citizens favor Lucius,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And will revolt from me to succor him.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: King, be thy thoughts imperious, like thy name.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Is the sun dimm'd, that gnats do fly in it?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: The eagle suffers little birds to sing,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And is not careful what they mean thereby,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Knowing that with the shadow of his wings

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: He can at pleasure stint their melody:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Even so mayst thou the giddy men of Rome.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Then cheer thy spirit : for know, thou emperor,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: I will enchant the old Andronicus

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: With words more sweet, and yet more dangerous,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Than baits to fish, or honey-stalks to sheep,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: When as the one is wounded with the bait,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: The other rotted with delicious feed.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: But he will not entreat his son for us.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: If Tamora entreat him, then he will:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: For I can smooth and fill his aged ear

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: With golden promises; that, were his heart

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Almost impregnable, his old ears deaf,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Yet should both ear and heart obey my tongue.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Go thou before, be our ambassador:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Say that the emperor requests a parley

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Of warlike Lucius, and appoint the meeting

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Even at his father's house, the old Andronicus.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: AEmilius, do this message honourably:

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: And if he stand on hostage for his safety,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Bid him demand what pledge will please him best.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: AEMILIUS
line: Your bidding shall I do effectually.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Now will I to that old Andronicus;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And temper him with all the art I have,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: To pluck proud Lucius from the warlike Goths.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And now, sweet emperor, be blithe again,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And bury all thy fear in my devices.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Before the palace.
speaker: SATURNINUS
line: Then go successantly, and plead to him.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Approved warriors, and my faithful friends,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: I have received letters from great Rome,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Which signify what hate they bear their emperor

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: And how desirous of our sight they are.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Therefore, great lords, be, as your titles witness,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Imperious and impatient of your wrongs,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: And wherein Rome hath done you any scath,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Let him make treble satisfaction.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: First Goth
line: Brave slip, sprung from the great Andronicus,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: First Goth
line: Whose name was once our terror, now our comfort;

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: First Goth
line: Whose high exploits and honourable deeds

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: First Goth
line: Ingrateful Rome requites with foul contempt,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: First Goth
line: Be bold in us: we'll follow where thou lead'st,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: First Goth
line: Like stinging bees in hottest summer's day

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: First Goth
line: Led by their master to the flowered fields,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: First Goth
line: And be avenged on cursed Tamora.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: All the Goths
line: And as he saith, so say we all with him.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: I humbly thank him, and I thank you all.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: But who comes here, led by a lusty Goth?

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: Renowned Lucius, from our troops I stray'd

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: To gaze upon a ruinous monastery;

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: And, as I earnestly did fix mine eye

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: Upon the wasted building, suddenly

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: I heard a child cry underneath a wall.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: I made unto the noise; when soon I heard

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: The crying babe controll'd with this discourse:

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: 'Peace, tawny slave, half me and half thy dam!

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: Did not thy hue bewray whose brat thou art,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: Had nature lent thee but thy mother's look,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: Villain, thou mightst have been an emperor:

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: But where the bull and cow are both milk-white,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: They never do beget a coal-black calf.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: Peace, villain, peace!'--even thus he rates

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: the babe,--

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: 'For I must bear thee to a trusty Goth;

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: Who, when he knows thou art the empress' babe,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: Will hold thee dearly for thy mother's sake.'

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: With this, my weapon drawn, I rush'd upon him,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: Surprised him suddenly, and brought him hither,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Second Goth
line: To use as you think needful of the man.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: O worthy Goth, this is the incarnate devil

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: That robb'd Andronicus of his good hand;

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: This is the pearl that pleased your empress' eye,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: And here's the base fruit of his burning lust.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Say, wall-eyed slave, whither wouldst thou convey

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: This growing image of thy fiend-like face?

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Why dost not speak? what, deaf? not a word?

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: A halter, soldiers! hang him on this tree.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: And by his side his fruit of bastardy.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Touch not the boy; he is of royal blood.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Too like the sire for ever being good.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: First hang the child, that he may see it sprawl;

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: A sight to vex the father's soul withal.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Get me a ladder.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Lucius, save the child,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: And bear it from me to the empress.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: If thou do this, I'll show thee wondrous things,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: That highly may advantage thee to hear:

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: If thou wilt not, befall what may befall,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: I'll speak no more but 'Vengeance rot you all!'

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Say on: an if it please me which thou speak'st

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Thy child shall live, and I will see it nourish'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: An if it please thee! why, assure thee, Lucius,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: 'Twill vex thy soul to hear what I shall speak;

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: For I must talk of murders, rapes and massacres,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Acts of black night, abominable deeds,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Complots of mischief, treason, villanies

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Ruthful to hear, yet piteously perform'd:

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: And this shall all be buried by my death,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Unless thou swear to me my child shall live.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Tell on thy mind; I say thy child shall live.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Swear that he shall, and then I will begin.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Who should I swear by? thou believest no god:

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: That granted, how canst thou believe an oath?

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: What if I do not? as, indeed, I do not;

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Yet, for I know thou art religious

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: And hast a thing within thee called conscience,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: With twenty popish tricks and ceremonies,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Which I have seen thee careful to observe,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Therefore I urge thy oath; for that I know

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: An idiot holds his bauble for a god

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: And keeps the oath which by that god he swears,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: To that I'll urge him: therefore thou shalt vow

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: By that same god, what god soe'er it be,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: That thou adorest and hast in reverence,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: To save my boy, to nourish and bring him up;

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Or else I will discover nought to thee.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Even by my god I swear to thee I will.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: First know thou, I begot him on the empress.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: O most insatiate and luxurious woman!

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Tut, Lucius, this was but a deed of charity

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: To that which thou shalt hear of me anon.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: 'Twas her two sons that murder'd Bassianus;

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: They cut thy sister's tongue and ravish'd her

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: And cut her hands and trimm'd her as thou saw'st.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: O detestable villain! call'st thou that trimming?

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Why, she was wash'd and cut and trimm'd, and 'twas

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Trim sport for them that had the doing of it.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: O barbarous, beastly villains, like thyself!

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Indeed, I was their tutor to instruct them:

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: That codding spirit had they from their mother,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: As sure a card as ever won the set;

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: That bloody mind, I think, they learn'd of me,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: As true a dog as ever fought at head.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Well, let my deeds be witness of my worth.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: I train'd thy brethren to that guileful hole

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Where the dead corpse of Bassianus lay:

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: I wrote the letter that thy father found

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: And hid the gold within the letter mention'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Confederate with the queen and her two sons:

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: And what not done, that thou hast cause to rue,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Wherein I had no stroke of mischief in it?

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: I play'd the cheater for thy father's hand,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: And, when I had it, drew myself apart

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: And almost broke my heart with extreme laughter:

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: I pry'd me through the crevice of a wall

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: When, for his hand, he had his two sons' heads;

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Beheld his tears, and laugh'd so heartily,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: That both mine eyes were rainy like to his :

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: And when I told the empress of this sport,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: She swooned almost at my pleasing tale,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: And for my tidings gave me twenty kisses.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: First Goth
line: What, canst thou say all this, and never blush?

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Ay, like a black dog, as the saying is.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Art thou not sorry for these heinous deeds?

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Ay, that I had not done a thousand more.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Even now I curse the day--and yet, I think,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Few come within the compass of my curse,--

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Wherein I did not some notorious ill,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: As kill a man, or else devise his death,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Ravish a maid, or plot the way to do it,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Accuse some innocent and forswear myself,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Set deadly enmity between two friends,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Make poor men's cattle break their necks;

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Set fire on barns and hay-stacks in the night,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: And bid the owners quench them with their tears.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Oft have I digg'd up dead men from their graves,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: And set them upright at their dear friends' doors,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Even when their sorrows almost were forgot;

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: And on their skins, as on the bark of trees,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Have with my knife carved in Roman letters,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: 'Let not your sorrow die, though I am dead.'

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: Tut, I have done a thousand dreadful things

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: As willingly as one would kill a fly,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: And nothing grieves me heartily indeed

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: But that I cannot do ten thousand more.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Bring down the devil; for he must not die

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: So sweet a death as hanging presently.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: If there be devils, would I were a devil,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: To live and burn in everlasting fire,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: So I might have your company in hell,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AARON
line: But to torment you with my bitter tongue!

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Sirs, stop his mouth, and let him speak no more.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Third Goth
line: My lord, there is a messenger from Rome

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: Third Goth
line: Desires to be admitted to your presence.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Let him come near.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Welcome, AEmilius what's the news from Rome?

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AEMILIUS
line: Lord Lucius, and you princes of the Goths,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AEMILIUS
line: The Roman emperor greets you all by me;

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AEMILIUS
line: And, for he understands you are in arms,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AEMILIUS
line: He craves a parley at your father's house,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AEMILIUS
line: Willing you to demand your hostages,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: AEMILIUS
line: And they shall be immediately deliver'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: First Goth
line: What says our general?

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: AEmilius, let the emperor give his pledges

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: Unto my father and my uncle Marcus,

scene: SCENE I.  Plains near Rome.
speaker: LUCIUS
line: And we will come. March away.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Thus, in this strange and sad habiliment,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: I will encounter with Andronicus,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And say I am Revenge, sent from below

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: To join with him and right his heinous wrongs.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Knock at his study, where, they say, he keeps,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: To ruminate strange plots of dire revenge;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Tell him Revenge is come to join with him,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And work confusion on his enemies.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Who doth molest my contemplation?

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Is it your trick to make me ope the door,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: That so my sad decrees may fly away,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And all my study be to no effect?

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: You are deceived: for what I mean to do

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: See here in bloody lines I have set down;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And what is written shall be executed.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Titus, I am come to talk with thee.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: No, not a word; how can I grace my talk,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Wanting a hand to give it action?

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thou hast the odds of me; therefore no more.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: If thou didst know me, thou wouldest talk with me.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I am not mad; I know thee well enough:

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Witness this wretched stump, witness these crimson lines;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Witness these trenches made by grief and care,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Witness the tiring day and heavy night;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Witness all sorrow, that I know thee well

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For our proud empress, mighty Tamora:

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Is not thy coming for my other hand?

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Know, thou sad man, I am not Tamora;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: She is thy enemy, and I thy friend:

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: I am Revenge: sent from the infernal kingdom,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: To ease the gnawing vulture of thy mind,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: By working wreakful vengeance on thy foes.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Come down, and welcome me to this world's light;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Confer with me of murder and of death:

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: There's not a hollow cave or lurking-place,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: No vast obscurity or misty vale,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Where bloody murder or detested rape

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Can couch for fear, but I will find them out;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And in their ears tell them my dreadful name,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Revenge, which makes the foul offender quake.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Art thou Revenge? and art thou sent to me,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To be a torment to mine enemies?

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: I am; therefore come down, and welcome me.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Do me some service, ere I come to thee.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Lo, by thy side where Rape and Murder stands;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Now give me some surance that thou art Revenge,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Stab them, or tear them on thy chariot-wheels;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And then I'll come and be thy waggoner,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And whirl along with thee about the globe.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Provide thee two proper palfreys, black as jet,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To hale thy vengeful waggon swift away,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And find out murderers in their guilty caves:

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And when thy car is loaden with their heads,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I will dismount, and by the waggon-wheel

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Trot, like a servile footman, all day long,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Even from Hyperion's rising in the east

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Until his very downfall in the sea:

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And day by day I'll do this heavy task,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: So thou destroy Rapine and Murder there.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: These are my ministers, and come with me.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Are these thy ministers? what are they call'd?

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Rapine and Murder; therefore called so,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Cause they take vengeance of such kind of men.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Good Lord, how like the empress' sons they are!

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And you, the empress! but we worldly men

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Have miserable, mad, mistaking eyes.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: O sweet Revenge, now do I come to thee;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And, if one arm's embracement will content thee,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I will embrace thee in it by and by.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: This closing with him fits his lunacy

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Whate'er I forge to feed his brain-sick fits,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Do you uphold and maintain in your speeches,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: For now he firmly takes me for Revenge;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And, being credulous in this mad thought,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: I'll make him send for Lucius his son;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And, whilst I at a banquet hold him sure,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: I'll find some cunning practise out of hand,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: To scatter and disperse the giddy Goths,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Or, at the least, make them his enemies.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: See, here he comes, and I must ply my theme.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Long have I been forlorn, and all for thee:

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Welcome, dread Fury, to my woful house:

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Rapine and Murder, you are welcome too.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: How like the empress and her sons you are!

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Well are you fitted, had you but a Moor:

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Could not all hell afford you such a devil?

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: For well I wot the empress never wags

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But in her company there is a Moor;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And, would you represent our queen aright,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: It were convenient you had such a devil:

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: But welcome, as you are. What shall we do?

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: What wouldst thou have us do, Andronicus?

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: DEMETRIUS
line: Show me a murderer, I'll deal with him.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: CHIRON
line: Show me a villain that hath done a rape,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: CHIRON
line: And I am sent to be revenged on him.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Show me a thousand that have done thee wrong,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And I will be revenged on them all.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Look round about the wicked streets of Rome;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And when thou find'st a man that's like thyself.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Good Murder, stab him; he's a murderer.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Go thou with him; and when it is thy hap

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: To find another that is like to thee,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Good Rapine, stab him; he's a ravisher.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Go thou with them; and in the emperor's court

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: There is a queen, attended by a Moor;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Well mayst thou know her by thy own proportion,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: for up and down she doth resemble thee:

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: I pray thee, do on them some violent death;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: They have been violent to me and mine.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Well hast thou lesson'd us; this shall we do.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: But would it please thee, good Andronicus,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: To send for Lucius, thy thrice-valiant son,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Who leads towards Rome a band of warlike Goths,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And bid him come and banquet at thy house;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: When he is here, even at thy solemn feast,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: I will bring in the empress and her sons,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: The emperor himself and all thy foes;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And at thy mercy shalt they stoop and kneel,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And on them shalt thou ease thy angry heart.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: What says Andronicus to this device?

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Marcus, my brother! 'tis sad Titus calls.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Go, gentle Marcus, to thy nephew Lucius;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Thou shalt inquire him out among the Goths:

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Bid him repair to me, and bring with him

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Some of the chiefest princes of the Goths;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Bid him encamp his soldiers where they are:

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Tell him the emperor and the empress too

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Feast at my house, and he shall feast with them.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: This do thou for my love; and so let him,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: As he regards his aged father's life.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
line: This will I do, and soon return again.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Now will I hence about thy business,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: And take my ministers along with me.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Nay, nay, let Rape and Murder stay with me;

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: Or else I'll call my brother back again,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TITUS ANDRONICUS
line: And cleave to no revenge but Lucius.

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Aside to her sons  What say you, boys? will you

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: bide with him,

scene: SCENE II.  Rome. Before TITUS's house.
speaker: TAMORA
line: Whiles I go tell my lord the emperor
